DataElement.preferredName: Lung Lymph Node Anatomic Location Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The named locations of, or within, the pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the position within the body of a rounded mass of lymphatic tissue in proximity to the organs of respiration occupying the thoracic cavity or relative proximity to those organs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: Relating to anatomy.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/23/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The larger lobe of the left lung, situated below and behind the oblique fissure.

Concepts.longName: Lower Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The larger lobe of the left lung, situated below and behind the oblique fissure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Refers to the area where nerves and blood vessels attach to an organ.: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Refers to the area associated with the hilum.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: (mee-dee-a-STYE-num) The area between the lungs. The organs in this area include the heart and its large blood vessels, the trachea, the esophagus, the bronchi, and lymph nodes.: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

An anatomic site along the midline and under the sternum that contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Left Lung
Concepts.definition: The smaller lobe of the left lung, situated above and in front the oblique fissure, which includes the apex.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Refers to the area where nerves and blood vessels attach to an organ.: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung situated below the oblique fissure.

Concepts.longName: Lower Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The lobe of the right lung situated below the oblique fissure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: (mee-dee-a-STYE-num) The area between the lungs. PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest, wedge-shaped lobe of the right lung; includes the lower part of the anterior border and the anterior part of the base of the lung.

Concepts.longName: Middle Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The smallest lobe of the right lung, situated above the oblique fissure and below the horizontal fissure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lobe of the right lung, situated above the horizontal fissure, which includes the apex.

Concepts.longName: Upper Lobe of the Right Lung
Concepts.definition: The lobe of the right lung, situated above the horizontal fissure, which includes the apex.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Below the carina.: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: Below the carina.
